What is an operating system, give two examples?
Software that manages hardware and runs other programs (Windows / Linux / macOC / Android / IOS / Harmony OS)
What does 'GUI" stand for?
Graphic User Interface (using buttons/icons to interact)
What is a web browser, give three examples?
Software to access the internet (Chrome / Internet Explorer / Firefox / Opera)
What does word processor do, and give two examples
To edit text documents (Microsoft Word / Google Docs / NOT notepad)
What is open-source software, and are they the norm?
Software with code anyone can view and modify, they are quite rare.
What is a "beta version" of software?
A test release for feedback before the final launch.
What does "compatibility" mean in software?
Whether a program works with your OS/hardware.
What is a "license key"?
A code to activate paid software, often after free trial runs out.
What does file extension do?
the suffix after a file name tells your OS/program what to open the file with
What is the difference between JPG and PNG?
JPG is the commonly accepted final photo format, with loss from compression. PNG is closer to original quality and allows better editing.
How does PDF differ from DOCs?
PDF is a file format that preserves layout and offers better presentation than normal word files.
How do we compress file/files?
Use WinRAR or zip to reduce the size of file/files as well as packaging together
What is malware?
Malicious software that harms devices/data.
List 3 types of malware
spyware / adware / trojans / worms / ransomware
What is VPN and explain its main use
Virtual Private Network, hides your IP / access geo-restricted content / bypass censorship / protect from hacking
How do you force-quit a frozen program?
Use Task Manager (Windows)
What is the first step to fix a software issue?
Reboot the program/device
What is "lag"?
A delay in response either from local hardware issue or slow internet speed
What is the difference between wi-fi and mobile data?
Wifi uses a router, capable of faster speed and more bandwidth / mobile data uses cellular networks
What is bandwidth?
Maximum amount of data that can move through the pipe, which differs from the actual speed reached
Identify the average size of a JPG, MP3, MP4, TXT, as close as possible
JPG (image, 200k to 3m), MP3 (music, 3 to 6m), MP4 (movie, 700m to 4G), txt (word, 1k to 50k)
What is streaming?
Playing online media WITHOUT downloading it locally
What is a "cookie" in browers?
A small file that stores website preferences/login info, can cause security concerns sometimes
What is an algorithm?
A step by step procedure to solve a problem.
What is an "API"?
Application Programming Interface, a way for programs to communicate
What is a spreadsheet used for?
Organizing data in rows/columns, often for reporting purpose. (Excel, Google Sheets)
What program is commonly used to make presentation?
Powerpoint, Google Slides
What does "plug and play" mean?
Devices would work immediately when connected, no setup required
How are AI chatbots programmed?
By combining Machine Learning models with Natural Language Processing NLP to gather data then respond with correct interpretation of user input
Name three main types of IT jobs
Systems analyst / web developer / data scientist / database admin / IT technician / computer programmer / software engineer / network engineer
